alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Crook; Wyoming Black Hills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 29 at 1:59AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN BUTTE...SOUTHWESTERN MEADE...LAWRENCE AND EAST CENTRAL CROOK COUNTIES THROUGH 300 AM MDT... At 158 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles northeast of Aladdin to 3 miles west of Crow Peak to 2 miles southwest of Cement Ridge Lookout. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Spearfish, Crow Peak, Savoy, Bridal Veil Falls, Roughlock Falls, Iron Creek Lake, and Spearfish Canyon around 205 AM MDT. Belle Fourche, Cheyenne Crossing, and Terry Peak around 210 AM MDT. Lead, Deadwood, Saint Onge, and Central City around 215 AM MDT. Whitewood, Fruitdale, and southeastern Belle Fourche Reservoir around 220 AM MDT. Sturgis, Galena, and Apple Springs around 225 AM MDT. Nisland around 230 AM MDT. Fort Meade and Bear Butte State Park around 235 AM MDT. Newell and Vale around 240 AM MDT. This includes... Interstate 90 in South Dakota between Mile Markers 1 and 43. Interstate 90 in Wyoming between Mile Markers 204 and 207. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
